info.title: Cortex SDK API
info.description: REST APIs for Cortex AI retrieval engine

post.description: Ask a question to your uploaded knowledge base and let Cortex AI answer it.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
Retrieve all sources for a specific tenant.

Use this endpoint to fetch a complete list of all sources associated with your tenant. This includes documents, files, and other content you've uploaded for processing.

You can optionally specify a sub-tenant to narrow down the results to sources within that specific sub-tenant scope.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Retrieve specific sources by their IDs.

Use this endpoint to fetch one or more sources by providing their unique identifiers. This is useful when you need detailed information about specific documents or content you've previously uploaded.

Provide the source IDs in the request body along with your tenant information to get the exact sources you need.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
Retrieve relations for a specific source.

Use this endpoint to fetch all relations associated with a specific source. This is useful when you need to understand the relationships between entities within a source.

Provide the source ID in the request body along with your tenant information to get the relations for that source.

parameters.name: source_id

schema.description: The source ID to fetch relations for
schema.title: Source Id

parameters.description: The source ID to fetch relations for

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

get.description:
Retrieve all stored user memories for your tenant.

This endpoint returns a comprehensive list of all user memories that have been stored,
whether they were added manually or generated through AI. User memories help personalize
your experience by storing context, preferences, and important information.

You can optionally specify a sub-tenant to filter memories within that specific scope.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

delete.description:
Permanently remove a specific user memory from storage.

This endpoint allows you to delete a user memory by its unique identifier.
Once deleted, the memory cannot be recovered, so use this operation carefully.

The memory will be removed from your tenant's storage and will no longer
appear in search results or memory listings.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.name: memory_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the memory to delete
schema.title: Memory Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the memory to delete

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Find relevant user memories using semantic search and knowledge graph.

This endpoint performs parallel searches:
1. Semantic search in Weaviate across all stored user memories
2. Entity-based search in the knowledge graph for memory entities

Results from both sources are combined and ranked by relevance to provide
comprehensive memory retrieval.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

parameters.name: max_count

schema.description: Maximum number of memories to return (default: 5)
schema.title: Max Count

parameters.description: Maximum number of memories to return (default: 5)

schema.description: Request body containing the search query

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Store new user memories for future reference.

This endpoint allows you to add memories in two formats:
1. Raw text string - A single text-based memory
2. User/Assistant pairs array - Conversation pairs that will be chunked as a single memory

The stored memories will be chunked, indexed in both Weaviate and the knowledge graph,
and made available for semantic search and graph-based retrieval.

post.description:
Upload multiple documents simultaneously for efficient bulk processing.

This endpoint allows you to upload several files at once, which is ideal for large document collections or periodic data imports. Each file gets processed asynchronously, and you can track the progress of individual files using their returned file IDs.

The system automatically handles file parsing, content extraction, and indexing across all uploaded documents. You'll receive confirmation once all files are queued for processing.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

patch.description:
Update multiple existing documents with new content and metadata.

Use this endpoint when you need to replace or modify several documents that are already in your knowledge base. Each file must correspond to an existing source ID, ensuring that updates are applied to the correct documents.

The system processes updates asynchronously, allowing you to continue working while your documents are re-indexed. Track the progress using the returned file IDs to know when updates are complete.

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

post.description:
Upload a single document for processing and indexing into your knowledge base.

This endpoint accepts documents in various formats and processes them for search and retrieval. You can include custom metadata to help organize and categorize your content.

The system extracts text content, processes it asynchronously, and makes it available for search queries. You can track the processing status using the returned file ID.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

patch.description:
Replace an existing document with updated content.

This endpoint allows you to update a specific document that's already in your knowledge base. Provide the source ID of the document you want to modify, along with the new file content.

The system will process your update asynchronously and re-index the document with the new content. You can monitor the progress using the returned file ID.

post.description:
Upload structured data from applications or APIs for indexing.

This endpoint is designed for importing data from applications. If you are specifically using Cortex to provide search to an application, you should prefer this endpoint. It accepts structured source objects and allows you to clearly define contents of attachments

The system processes each source asynchronously and makes the content available for search and retrieval. Use this when you need to integrate search and indexing from data in your applications into your knowledge base.

post.description:
Upload text or markdown content directly for processing.

This endpoint accepts plain text or markdown-formatted content that you want to add to your knowledge base. It's perfect for notes, documentation, articles, or any text-based content you want to make searchable.

You can include custom metadata to help organize and categorize your content. You can track the processing status using the returned file ID.

This endpoint allows you to modify text or markdown content that's already in your knowledge base. Provide the source ID of the content you want to update, along with the new text.

The system will reprocess and re-index the updated content asynchronously. Use this when you need to correct information, add details, or refresh existing documentation.

post.description:
Upload pre-computed embeddings for advanced similarity search.

This endpoint accepts vector embeddings that you've generated externally, allowing you to integrate with custom embedding models or existing vector databases. The embeddings represent chunks of your content as numerical vectors.

The system stores these embeddings and makes them available for semantic search and similarity matching. Use this when you want to leverage specialized embedding models or have existing vector representations.

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the tenant/organization

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

patch.description:
Update existing embeddings with new vector representations.

This endpoint allows you to modify embeddings that are already stored in your knowledge base. Provide updated vector representations for specific chunks of content, identified by their chunk IDs.

The system will replace the existing embeddings with your new ones, ensuring that similarity searches reflect the most current vector representations. Use this when you need to update embeddings due to model improvements or content changes.

post.description:
Extract and index content from web pages automatically.

This endpoint initiates web scraping for the specified URL, extracting the main content, text, and structure from the webpage. It's perfect for capturing articles, documentation, or any web content you want to include in your knowledge base.

The system processes the webpage content asynchronously, cleaning and structuring the information for optimal search and retrieval. Use this when you need to add web content without manual copying and pasting.

parameters.name: web_url

schema.description: The URL of the webpage to scrape and index
schema.title: Web Url

parameters.description: The URL of the webpage to scrape and index

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier used to organize data within a tenant. If omitted, the default sub-tenant created during tenant setup will be used.

parameters.name: file_id

schema.description: Optional custom file ID for the scraped content. If not provided, a unique ID will be generated
schema.title: File Id

parameters.description: Optional custom file ID for the scraped content. If not provided, a unique ID will be generated

patch.description:
Update web scraping content with fresh data from the source URL.

This endpoint refreshes the content for an existing web scraping job. Provide the source ID of the webpage content you want to update, and the system will re-scrape the URL to capture any changes.

The updated content gets processed asynchronously and re-indexed in your knowledge base. Use this to keep web content current when the source pages are frequently updated.

Extract and index content from multiple web pages simultaneously.

This endpoint initiates web scraping for multiple URLs at once, extracting the main content, text, and structure from each webpage. It's perfect for capturing multiple articles, documentation pages, or any web content you want to include in your knowledge base.

The system processes all webpage content asynchronously, cleaning and structuring the information for optimal search and retrieval.

delete.description:
Remove documents and content from your knowledge base.

This endpoint permanently deletes the specified sources from your knowledge base. Once deleted, the content will no longer be available for search or retrieval.

Use this carefully as the action cannot be undone. The system will confirm successful deletion of each source ID you specify.

schema.description: Request body containing the source IDs to delete and tenant information

delete.description:
Remove documents and content from your knowledge base.

This endpoint permanently deletes the specified sources from your knowledge base. Once deleted, the content will no longer be available for search or retrieval.

Use this carefully as the action cannot be undone. The system will confirm successful deletion of each source ID you specify.

schema.description: Request body containing the source IDs to delete and tenant information

post.description:
Check the current processing status of your uploaded content.

This endpoint allows you to monitor the progress of documents, text, or other content you've uploaded. Simply provide the file ID to see whether processing is complete, still in progress, or if any errors occurred.

Use this to determine when your content is ready for search and retrieval, or to troubleshoot any processing issues.

post.description:
Search for relevant content within your indexed sources.

This API returns the chunks related to the query you make. We use neural (embedding) search to give you the most relevant chunks.
Results are ranked by relevance and can be customized with parameters like result limits and recency preferences.

404.description: Not Found - Resource does not exist

post.description:
Perform full text search for exact matches within your indexed sources.

Use this endpoint to find content chunks using BM25-based text matching with configurable operators.
Choose between 'OR' and 'AND' operators to control how search terms are combined for precise text matching.

schema.title: Response Full Text Search Search Full Text Search Post

Use this to remove specific chunks from your embeddings index when they are no longer valid or should not appear in results.

Use this to retrieve the most similar chunk IDs to a single query embedding.

post.description:
Create a tenant for your account.

Use this endpoint to initialize a tenant space you can use for ingestion, embeddings, and search. Optionally include a metadata schema to enforce consistent attributes across documents.

Expected outcome

- If the tenant already exists, you receive a success message with the existing identifier.

get.description:
Retrieve usage stats for your tenant.

Use this endpoint to check whether a tenant exists and view core metrics like total indexed objects and vector dimension. This helps you validate setup and monitor ingestion.

Expected outcome
- You receive the current object count and vector dimension for the tenant.
- If the tenant does not exist, you get a not-found error.

post.description:
Index a conversation while forwarding the request to the specified LLM provider.

This endpoint performs indexing in parallel with the LLM API call.
All OpenAI-native parameters are passed in the request body.
Custom parameters (provider, tenant_id, etc.) are passed as query parameters.

Supports: OpenAI, Anthropic (Claude), and Google (Gemini) through OpenAI-compatible interface.

parameters.name: provider

schema.description: LLM provider. Supported: openai, anthropic, gemini
schema.title: Provider

parameters.description: LLM provider. Supported: openai, anthropic, gemini

parameters.name: tenant_id

schema.description: Primary tenant identifier for indexing
schema.title: Tenant Id

parameters.description: Primary tenant identifier for indexing

parameters.name: sub_tenant_id

schema.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier
schema.title: Sub Tenant Id

parameters.description: Optional sub-tenant identifier

parameters.name: file_id

schema.description: Optional stable identifier for the indexed conversation
schema.title: File Id

parameters.description: Optional stable identifier for the indexed conversation

schema.description: JSON-encoded tenant-level metadata
schema.title: Tenant Metadata

parameters.description: JSON-encoded tenant-level metadata

parameters.name: document_metadata

schema.description: JSON-encoded document-specific metadata
schema.title: Document Metadata

post.description:
Search knowledge base and augment request with retrieved context.

This endpoint:
1. Extracts the last user message and rewrites it for better search
2. Performs search with the rewritten query
3. Appends search results to the last user message
4. Forwards the augmented request to the specified LLM provider

All OpenAI-native parameters are passed in the request body.
Custom parameters can be passed as either query parameters OR custom headers (x-provider, x-tenant-id, etc.).
Headers are useful when using the OpenAI SDK which doesn't support custom query parameters.

Supports: OpenAI, Anthropic (Claude), and Google (Gemini) through OpenAI-compatible interface.

parameters.name: provider

schema.description: LLM provider. Supported: openai, anthropic, gemini
schema.title: Provider

post.description:
Perform both indexing and search, then forward to LLM provider with augmented context.

This endpoint:
1. Indexes the conversation in parallel with search
2. Generates a rewritten query and performs search
3. Appends search results to the last user message
4. Forwards the augmented request to the specified LLM provider
5. Returns LLM response with both indexing and retrieval metadata

All OpenAI-native parameters are passed in the request body.
Custom parameters can be passed as either query parameters OR custom headers (x-provider, x-tenant-id, etc.).
Headers are useful when using the OpenAI SDK which doesn't support custom query parameters.

Supports: OpenAI, Anthropic (Claude), and Google (Gemini) through OpenAI-compatible interface.

model.title: Model
model.description: Identifier of the chat model to emulate when responding to the request.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: Ordered conversation history that should be interpreted as an OpenAI Chat Completions payload.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If true, stream responses as server-sent events following OpenAI's streaming semantics.

stream_options.title: Stream Options
stream_options.description: Optional streaming configuration forwarded to OpenAI APIs when streaming is requested.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature applied to OpenAI text generation.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: Nucleus sampling parameter forwarded to OpenAI.

max_completion_tokens.title: Max Completion Tokens
max_completion_tokens.description: Upper bound on the number of tokens OpenAI may generate in the completion phase.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: OpenAI frequency penalty applied during generation.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: OpenAI presence penalty applied during generation.

n.title: N
n.description: Number of choices to generate via OpenAI chat completions.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Modify likelihood of specified tokens in OpenAI generation.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Request OpenAI to include token log probabilities when supported.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: Number of top token log probabilities OpenAI should return when logprobs=true.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: Structured response directive forwarded to OpenAI (e.g. json_schema).

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Optional sampling seed forwarded to OpenAI for best-effort deterministic output.

service_tier.title: Service Tier
service_tier.description: Processing service tier requested for OpenAI completion.

tool_choice.title: Tool Choice
tool_choice.description: Specifies which tool OpenAI should invoke when tools are supplied.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: Collection of tool definitions forwarded to OpenAI.

parallel_tool_calls.title: Parallel Tool Calls
parallel_tool_calls.description: Flag enabling OpenAI parallel function/tool calls when supported.

prediction.title: Prediction
prediction.description: Prediction configuration forwarded to OpenAI Responses/Completions API.

reasoning_effort.title: Reasoning Effort
reasoning_effort.description: Constrains OpenAI reasoning effort for reasoning-capable models.

modalities.title: Modalities
modalities.description: Modalities requested from multimodal OpenAI models.

audio.title: Audio
audio.description: Audio generation configuration forwarded to OpenAI when requesting audio output.

prompt_cache_key.title: Prompt Cache Key
prompt_cache_key.description: Stable identifier for leveraging OpenAI prompt caching features.

safety_identifier.title: Safety Identifier
safety_identifier.description: Identifier used to assist OpenAI with safety signal tracking.

user.title: User
user.description: End-user identifier forwarded to OpenAI for abuse monitoring.

verbosity.title: Verbosity
verbosity.description: Controls verbosity of OpenAI reasoning models when supported.

web_search_options.title: Web Search Options
web_search_options.description: Configuration for OpenAI-integrated web search when enabled.

OpenAIBaseChatRequest.title: OpenAIBaseChatRequest
OpenAIBaseChatRequest.description:
Pure OpenAI Chat Completions request model containing only OpenAI-native parameters.
Custom parameters like tenant_id should be passed as query parameters.

role.title: Role
role.description: Role of the message author. Typically 'system', 'user', or 'assistant'.

content.title: Content
content.description: Message content supplied by the author in plain text.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: Identifier for the file whose status is being retrieved

indexing_status.title: Indexing Status
indexing_status.description: Current status of the file. Possible values are 'queued', 'processing', 'completed', 'errored'

error_code.title: Error Code
error_code.description: Error code for the file. You may share this code with us to help us diagnose and resolve the issue.

message.title: Message
message.description: Detailed status message about the processing operation

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: Unique identifier for the conversation session. Keep it same when the current question refers to a previous answer or question

context_list.title: Context List
context_list.description: List of context strings to provide additional information

search_modes.title: Search Modes
search_modes.description: List of search modes to use for finding relevant information

sub_tenant_id.title: Sub Tenant Id
sub_tenant_id.description: Identifier for sub-tenant within the tenant

highlight_chunks.title: Highlight Chunks
highlight_chunks.description: Whether to return text chunks in the response along with final LLM generated answer

search_alpha.title: Search Alpha
search_alpha.description: Closer to 0.0 means a exact keyword search will be performed, closer to 1.0 means semantics of the search will be considered. In most cases, you wont have to toggle it yourself.

recency_bias.title: Recency Bias
recency_bias.description: Bias towards more recent information (0.0 to 1.0)

ai_generation.title: Ai Generation
ai_generation.description: Whether to use AI for generating responses

top_n.title: Top N
top_n.description: Number of top results to return

user_name.title: User Name
user_name.description: Name of the user making the request. This helps LLM to know the user's name if semantics around the username are involved in query. Its generally a good practice to include it possible.

user_instructions.title: User Instructions
user_instructions.description: Custom instructions for the AI response to add to our proprietary prompt. This can be used to provide additional context or instructions for the LLM to follow so that the answers are tailored towards your application style

multi_step_reasoning.title: Multi Step Reasoning
multi_step_reasoning.description: Enable advanced multi-step reasoning for complex queries. When enabled, the AI will automatically break down complex questions into multiple research steps to provide more comprehensive and accurate answers.

auto_agent_routing.title: Auto Agent Routing
auto_agent_routing.description: Enable intelligent agent routing to automatically select the most suitable AI agent for your specific query type. Different agents are optimized for various use cases like social media, code, conversations, general knowledge, etc.

context.title: Context
context.description: Rich contextual description of the relationship with surrounding information, details about how/why/when, and any relevant background. Should be comprehensive enough to understand the relationship without referring back to source.

temporal_details.title: Temporal Details
temporal_details.description: Temporal timing information extracted from text (e.g., 'last week', 'in 2023', 'yesterday')

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Timestamp when this relation was introduced

RelationEvidence.title: RelationEvidence
RelationEvidence.description: Single piece of evidence for a relationship between two entities

cortex_source_ids.title: Cortex Source Ids
cortex_source_ids.description: List of cortex source IDs to directly relate with

auto_discovery.title: Auto Discovery
auto_discovery.description: Key value pairs to allow cortex to automatically discover relations

extra_graph_context.title: Extra Graph Context
extra_graph_context.description: Extra graph context which will help you agent get better understanding of the entities involved in query.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Additional metadata about the retrieval run

query.title: Query
query.description: Search query to find relevant user memories

success.title: Success
success.description: Indicates whether the memory retrieval operation was successful

retrieved_user_memories.title: Retrieved User Memories
retrieved_user_memories.description: Array of user memories ranked by relevance to your search query

example.memory_content: I prefer detailed technical explanations and works in the Pacific timezone

relations.title: Relations
relations.description: Array of relations extracted from the user query

RetrieveUserMemoryResponse.description: Response model for retrieving user memories through semantic search.
